paper_title.ja: GENDER ISSUES IN SCIENCE EDUCATION IN JAPAN
paper_title.en: Gender Issues in Science Education in Japan

description.ja: The purpose of this study is to clarify gender differences in junior high school science students in Japan. In this paper, we describe gender imbalance in junior high school science education. As part of the study, 222 junior high school students were surveyed with the use of a questionnaire about gender issues in science classes. Additionally, as part 2 of the study, twenty junior high school science teachers were interviewed about gender issues in science classes. The results of these two surveys showed gender inequities in junior high school science education in Japan. We should therefore deliberate on the strategies to be used in science education for gender equity.
description.en: The purpose of this study is to clarify gender differences in junior high school science students in Japan. In this paper, we describe gender imbalance in junior high school science education. As part of the study, 222 junior high school students were surveyed with the use of a questionnaire about gender issues in science classes. Additionally, as part 2 of the study, twenty junior high school science teachers were interviewed about gender issues in science classes. The results of these two surveys showed gender inequities in junior high school science education in Japan. We should therefore deliberate on the strategies to be used in science education for gender equity.

paper_title.ja: Results and implications of children's views of science across six countries
paper_title.en: Results and Implications of Children's Views of Science Across Six Countries

description.ja: This article is about the study on 'Children's views of science' of Grades 5 and 8 students from Australia, China, Japan, Philippines, Thailand and the United States of America. The results show that with regards scientific method, students in Australia and the United States seem to value more the view of relativism than the traditional view on inductivism and deductivism. Japanese students seem to value relativism while in same cases also value inductivism and deductivism. Students from China, Philippines and Thailand seem to value STS with regards scientific progress and deductivism when it comes to scientific method. In general, students from Thailand seem to value all views, relativism, deductivism and STS. Based from the trends of responses, it can be concluded that Australia and USA are similar and Philippines and Thailand are also similar. Japan and China are quite distinct. This trend may be influenced by the national conditions or social needs for science education, educational system and policies, objective, curriculum content, method and strategies in science teaching in each country
description.en: This article is about the study on 'Children's views of science' of Grades 5 and 8 students from Australia, China, Japan, Philippines, Thailand and the United States of America. The results show that with regards scientific method, students in Australia and the United States seem to value more the view of relativism than the traditional view on inductivism and deductivism. Japanese students seem to value relativism while in same cases also value inductivism and deductivism. Students from China, Philippines and Thailand seem to value STS with regards scientific progress and deductivism when it comes to scientific method. In general, students from Thailand seem to value all views, relativism, deductivism and STS. Based from the trends of responses, it can be concluded that Australia and USA are similar and Philippines and Thailand are also similar. Japan and China are quite distinct. This trend may be influenced by the national conditions or social needs for science education, educational system and policies, objective, curriculum content, method and strategies in science teaching in each country

paper_title.ja: 教員養成大学における化学教育の現状-愛知教育大学における実践を中心として-
paper_title.en: Chemical Education in University as Preservice Training : The Curriculum and Practice of Aichi University of Education

description.ja: 教員養成を目的とする大学では, 教員免許状取得のための授業が多く, 化学教育のための授業時間に大きな制約がある。愛知教育大学には, 小・中・高等学校教員養成課程が置かれ, それぞれの課程で専門科目としての教科に関する科目と教職に関する科目が異なる。その制約の中で, どの課程にも教科を重視した教育(「ピーク型」教育)を行っている。本学の「ピーク型」教育における教科に関する専門科目としての「化学教育」の内容と問題点について述べる。
